ARABIC: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: the Day when neither wealth nor sons will be of any use -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: the Day when nothing will avail, neither wealth nor offspring,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: on the Day of Judgment when neither wealth nor children will be of any benefit
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “The day when neither wealth will benefit nor will sons.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The day on which property will not avail, nor sons
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: the day when neither wealth nor sons shall profit
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the Day when wealth and sons will be of no avail,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The Day whereon will profit neither substance nor sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The Day when neither wealth nor sons shall benefit
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Day when neither wealth nor children will help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:88] of which [day] God, exalted be He, says [the following]: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail, anyone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The day when wealth) the abundance of wealth (and sons) and abundance of sons (avail not (any man),
